Anorexia Nervosa
A. Restriction of energy intake relative to requirements, leading
to a significantly low body weight in the context of age, sex, devel-
opmental trajectory, and physical health. Significantly low weight
is defined as a weight that is less than minimally normal or, for chil-
dren and adolescents, less than that minimally expected.
B. Intense fear of gaining weight or of becoming fat, or persistent
behavior that interferes with weight gain, even though at a signif-
icantly low weight.
C. Disturbance in the way in which one’s body weight or shape is
experienced, undue influence of body weight or shape on self-
